title.value: Аллельный состав генов MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1, MD-EXP7 сортов яблони (Malus x Domestica) с различным сроком хранения плодов
Allelic diversity of MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1 and MD-EXP7 genes of apple cultivars (Malus x Domestica) with different storability

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Kuzmitskaya, P.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology
Kozlovskaya, Z.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing
Kartel, N.A., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology

abstract.value: Ability of the apple fruit to preserve gustatory qualities for a long time during the process of storage appears an important commercial characteristic. Different sorts of apples may vary storage life from 1-2 weeks up to 6 months. Phyto-hormone ethylene appears one of the most important indexes of shelf life of apple fruit. Synthesis of the ethylene is determined with MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1 and MD-EXP7 genes. Therefore, the main goal of the research, presented in the article, appears determination of the allelic diversity of the MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1 and MD-EXP7 genes and their correlation with fruit shelf life.  Allelic diversity of the genes MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1 and MD-EXP7 associated with fruit ethylene production and firmness is determined for 127 apple cultivars and hybrids. The genotypes associated with low and high ethylene are detected in cultivars with short and long shelf life. Some tested cultivars having long shelf life even do not contain the favorable alleles of the MD-ACS1, MD-ACO1 and MD-EXP7 genes. This is the evidence of the presence of other factors, which have essential impact on shelf life of apple cultivars tested. The results of genotyping of the apple cultivars can be used in marker-assisted selection for breeding apple cultivars for better storability and long shelf life.
